metadata.title: CVE-2023-31315 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow amalicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMIlock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31315` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

amd64-microcode - 3.20191218.1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: amd64-microcode package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20191218.1ubuntu2.3').
